front.title: XML Digital Signatures Extension for the Extensible Provisioning Protocol

abstract.t: This document describes an Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) extension mapping for the use of XML Digital Signatures.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document describes an extension mapping for version 1.0 of the Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP). This EPP mapping provides a mechanism by which digital signatures may be incorporated into EPP frames.

While EPP provides a number of security features, such as strong client-server authentication, it provides no mechanism for non-repudiation. This extension provides a means by which the contents of an EPP frame may be digitally signed, preventing future repudiation by the client or server which produced them.

section.title: Conventions Used in This Document
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

XML is case sensitive. Unless stated otherwise, XML specifications and examples provided in this document MUST be interpreted in the character case presented in order to develop a conforming implementation.

"eppSig-1.0" is used as an abbreviation for "&NAMESPACE;". The XML namespace prefix "eppSig" is used, but implementations MUST NOT depend on it and instead employ a proper namespace-aware XML parser and serializer to interpret and output the XML documents.

section.title: Extension Elements
section.t: This extension defines a single element, <eppSig:signature>, which may appear in the <extension> element of <command> and <result> frames.
The <eppSig:signature> element may contain any element permitted in .

section.title: Use of Signatures
section.t: Servers which support this extension MUST include the extension namespace in an <extURI> element in the the <svcExtension> element of the <greeting> frame. If the extension appears in the <svcExtension> is present in the <greeting> frame, the server MUST include an <eppSig:signature> element, and a valid XML digital signature, in the <extension> element of the <result> frames.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema targetNamespace="&NAMESPACE;" xmlns:eppSig="&NAMESPACE;" xmlns:ds="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified">
<import namespace="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#" />
<annotation> <documentation> Extensible Provisioning Protocol v1.0 XML digital signature extension schema </documentation> </annotation>
<!-- Child elements found in EPP commands. --> <element name="signature" type="eppSig:signatureType"/>
<complexType name="signatureType"> <sequence> <any namespace="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#" /> </sequence> </complexType> </schema>
